00022 /**
00023  * @file   apt-snp-compare.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Fri Feb 10 10:34:35 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief  Program for comparing the results of a snp prediction method to a known set.
00028  */
00029 
00030 //
00031 #include "file/TsvFile/SnpTable.h"
00032 #include "util/AptVersionInfo.h"
00033 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00034 #include "util/Util.h"

00036 #include <cstring>
00037 #include <iostream>
00038 #include <string>
00039 #include <vector>

00041 
00042 using namespace std;
00043 
00044 
00045 class StatCounts {
00046 
00047 public:
00048   int predicted;
00049   int correct;
00050   int wrong;
00051 
00052   StatCounts() {
00053     predicted = 0;
00054     correct = 0;
00055     wrong = 0;
00056   }
00057 };
00058 
00059 class GenoTypeCounts {
00060 
00061 public:
00062   StatCounts homoCalls;
00063   StatCounts hetCalls;
00064   StatCounts totalCalls;
00065   int total;
00066   int noCall;
00067   int notDetermined;
00068   GenoTypeCounts() {
00069     total = 0;
00070     noCall = 0;
00071     notDetermined = 0;
00072   }
00073 };
00074 
00075 void define_aptsnpcompare_options(PgOptions* opts)
00076 {
00077   opts->setUsage("apt-snp-compare compares the results of a snp prediction method to a known results set.\n"
00078                  "It takes as arguments a matrix file of predicted genotypes (the query) and a matrix\n"
00079                  "file of predicted genotypes (the target) and computes some summary statistics describing\n"
00080                  "how well the query matches the the target.\n"
00081                  "Matrix files should be tab separated, with the first column being snp identifiers\n"
00082                  "and the first row a header of 'probeset_id' followed by by chip names.\n"
00083                  "Columns and rows do not have to be matched; the program will determine the genotypes\n"
00084                  "to compare, using row and column identifiers.\n"
00085                  "usage:\n"
00086                  "   apt-snp-compare snp-predictions.mtx snp-known.mtx");
00087 
00088   opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00089                      "Print help message.",
00090                      "false");
00091   opts->defineOption("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00092                      "Display version information.",
00093                      "false");
00094 }
00095 
00096 void scoreSnp(SnpTable &qTable, SnpTable &tTable, GenoTypeCounts &counts, int rowIx, int colIx) {
00097   static int printWrongCount = 10;
00098   const string &rowName = qTable.getRowName(rowIx);
00099   const string &colName = qTable.getColName(colIx);
00100   int tRowIx = tTable.getRowIndex(rowName);
00101   int tColIx = tTable.getColIndex(colName);
00102   if(tRowIx == -1) 
00103     return;
00104     //    Err::errAbort("Can't find known SNP for identifier: " + rowName);
00105   if(tColIx == -1)  
00106     Err::errAbort("Can't find chip for identifier: " + colName);
00107   int qType = qTable.getGenotypeForSnp(rowIx, colIx);
00108   int tType = tTable.getGenotypeForSnp(tRowIx, tColIx);
00109   StatCounts *counter = NULL;
00110   counts.total++;
00111   /* If we don't actually know the genotype of this snp. */
00112   if(tType == SnpTable::NN) {
00113     counts.notDetermined++;
00114     return;
00115   }
00116  
00117   /* Determine if we are counting this as heterozygous or homozygous. 
00118      Good to break out as the het calls are often harder. */
00119   if(tType == SnpTable::AB) 
00120     counter = &counts.hetCalls;
00121   else if(tType == SnpTable::AA || tType == SnpTable::BB) 
00122     counter = &counts.homoCalls;
00123   else 
00124     Err::errAbort("Don't recognize genotype of: " + ToStr(tType));
00125   
00126   /* Score according to correctness. */
00127   if(qType == SnpTable::NN) {
00128     counts.noCall++;
00129     return;
00130   }
00131   counter->predicted++;
00132   counts.totalCalls.predicted++;
00133   if(qType == tType) {
00134     counter->correct++;
00135     counts.totalCalls.correct++;
00136   }
00137   else {
00138     if(printWrongCount > 0) {
00139       printWrongCount--;
00140       const string &tRowName = tTable.getRowName(tRowIx);
00141       const string &tColName = tTable.getColName(tColIx);
00142       Verbose::out(1, "Mistake example at predicted: " + rowName + " (" + ToStr(rowIx) + ") " + colName + " (" + ToStr(colIx) + 
00143                    ") vs known: " +
00144                    tRowName + " (" + ToStr(tRowIx) + ") " + tColName + " (" + ToStr(tColIx) + ") '" + ToStr(qType) + "' vs '" + ToStr(tType) + "'");
00145     }
00146     counter->wrong++;
00147     counts.totalCalls.wrong++;
00148   }
00149 }
00150 
00151 double accuracy(StatCounts &counts) {
00152   return (double) counts.correct / counts.predicted;
00153 }
00154 
00155 void reportResults(GenoTypeCounts &counts) {
00156   
00157   double callRate = (double) (counts.total - counts.noCall) / counts.total * 100;
00158   double callDeterminedRate = (double) (counts.total - counts.noCall - counts.notDetermined) / (counts.total - counts.notDetermined) * 100;
00159   Verbose::out(1,"Call rate: " + ToStr(callRate) + " For SNPs with known type: " + ToStr(callDeterminedRate));
00160   Verbose::out(1,"Overall Accuracy: " + ToStr(accuracy(counts.totalCalls) * 100));
00161   Verbose::out(1,"Het Accuracy: " + ToStr(accuracy(counts.hetCalls) * 100));
00162   Verbose::out(1,"Hom Accuracy: " + ToStr(accuracy(counts.homoCalls) * 100));
00163 }
00164 
00165     
00166 void compareGenotypes(const std::string& qFile, const std::string& tFile) {
00167   GenoTypeCounts counts;
00168 
00169   /* Get the data into memory. */
00170   SnpTable qTable, tTable;
00171   Verbose::out(1, "Reading file: " + qFile);
00172   qTable.open(qFile);
00173   Verbose::out(1, "Reading file: " + tFile);
00174   tTable.open(tFile);
00175 
00176   Verbose::out(1, "Comparing tables.");
00177   for(int rowIx = 0; rowIx < qTable.getNumRows(); rowIx++) {
00178     for(int colIx = 0; colIx < qTable.getNumCols(); colIx++) {
00179       scoreSnp(qTable, tTable, counts, rowIx, colIx);
00180     }
00181   }
00182 
00183   reportResults(counts);
00184 }
00185 
00186 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
00187   try {
00188     const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00189 
00190     PgOptions* opts=new PgOptions;
00191     define_aptsnpcompare_options(opts);
00192     opts->parseArgv(argv);
00193     
00194     if(opts->getBool("help") || argc == 1) {
00195         opts->usage();
00196         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00197     }
00198     else if(opts->getBool("version"))
00199         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00200     else
00201         compareGenotypes(opts->getArg(0), opts->getArg(1));
00202     
00203     delete opts;
00204     return 0;
00205   } 
00206   catch(...) {
00207       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00208       return 1;
00209   }
00210   return 0;
00211 }
